criteria: Explanation of How Influences Affect Choices
descriptions: The student fails to identify any internal influences on food choices.
The student identifies one internal influence on food choices with limited accuracy.
The student identifies two internal influences on food choices with some accuracy.
The student identifies three internal influences on food choices with good accuracy.
The student identifies four internal influences on food choices with accuracy and provides basic examples.
The student comprehensively identifies multiple internal influences (e.g., hunger, taste preferences, nutritional needs, mood) on food choices with detailed examples and explanations.
The student fails to identify any external influences on food choices.
The student identifies one external influence on food choices with limited accuracy.
The student identifies two external influences on food choices with some accuracy.
The student identifies three external influences on food choices with good accuracy.
The student identifies four external influences on food choices with accuracy and provides basic examples.
The student comprehensively identifies multiple external influences (e.g., culture, family, advertising, cost, availability) on food choices with detailed examples and explanations.
The student does not explain how internal or external influences affect food choices.
The student attempts to explain how one influence affects food choices, but the explanation is unclear or inaccurate.
The student provides a basic explanation of how one internal and one external influence affect food choices.
The student explains how multiple internal and external influences affect food choices with reasonable clarity.
The student clearly explains how multiple internal and external influences affect food choices, providing relevant examples.
The student thoroughly analyzes and explains how a wide range of internal and external influences interact to affect food choices, demonstrating a deep understanding of the complexities involved.
